channel.title: ToL's future and the importance of FoL
channel.description:
Right now the game is in an unsustainable state.
This shouldn't be news to anyone, it has always been like that and it's been getting better over time and will likely continue to do so.
What's more interesting is WHY it's unsustainable:
Right now, most players aren't very good at the game. Before now they were even worse but over time the average player get's better slowly. As this happens, mechanics that used to be fine become OP or UP depending on their purpose and the specifics behind the mechanic.
This is also to be expected as it happens with basically every game.
In Throne of Lies in particular this usually means reworking ability's with high confirmability and making neutrals either more hostile or easier to fake.
However, Forum of Lies has already gone down this route, but the difference is the FoL's format meant they had to do this sooner, faster and more thoroughly than ToL has had to so far.
But since ToL's playerbase is still improving that means Throne of Lies itself will continue becoming more and more competitively balanced as time goes on.
What this means is that Throne of Lies will very gradually approach Forum of Lies standards of balance. For FoL this means that effectively you are playing a test version of ToL 1-2 years from now. Solutions from one game can be used to solve problems in the other.
TLDR: The stuff in @Icibalus's mega rework (yet to actually be posted as of this thread) will probably make it in over the course of a year or two in one form or another.

item.title: ToL's future and the importance of FoL
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
Shrimpy:

The archer class card I read said it places 3 marks and when it attacks any mark all of them are killed, bypassing death immunity. Not a worse knight …

DatBird:

remove all marks

Nope, it’s a choice between spending 2 nights to remove death immunity and attack them or attacking multiple targets.

Shrimpy:

Why isn’t Multi-shot called Volley lol? But seriously this is close to being a Blue Dragon-aligned Sorcerer

FoL Class Cards (Now Officially Official)

Volley (Day) - If you shoot a bolt at one of your marks tonight, also attack any other players with a mark. You are immune to redirection this night. - Shared uses with 2-for-1

Shrimpy:

knight can’t bypass stonsekin or don armor or pret/inq/scorn etc. first-time immunity, I think the knight comparison is extremely weak

DatBird:

passively

Also let’s not pretend that it’s easy to play a town Arsonist in a turbo setup. If anything the ToL version should remove some of these restrictions to bring it up to par. A Sorcerer dictates who the NK kills and can lay bombs accordingly. An Archer doesn’t have that luxury. A Sorcerer aims for anyone that will live long. An Archer actually has to hit scum to be succesful and doesn’t have easy ways to swap and you know what you do with outed scum. You don’t patiently wait for several days for an Archer to setup a kill on them… you lynch them.

No, not done yet. In addition it’s wholly unconfirmable and would be a hugely popular claim under evil killers hence also weakening the Archer’s strength in that way. They can’t be forced to self resolve as easily like Knight’s CS can, because the Archer wouldn’t die as a Knight would. You’re literally so off base here.

Read full topic
item.source: ToL's future and the importance of FoL

item.title: ToL's future and the importance of FoL
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Since a random mark is just as likely to be BD as not, your second mark is more likely to be non-BD, and your third is guaranteed to be non-BD (unless you are dumb), every game where an archer survives to n4 will see 2 or 3 non-BD (maybe 1 BD but worth) exploded bypassing their death immunities.

I’m telling you this is insanely overpowered

Read full topic
